article.headline: McNeese St. 68, Louisiana-Lafayette 63
article.story: LAKE CHARLES, La. (AP) -- Jarvis Bradley scored 17 points and grabbed 10 rebounds as McNeese State posted a 68-63 basketball victory over Louisiana-Lafayette on Saturday night. McNeese (5-7) held a 34-29 halftime lead but had to come back at the end of the game to pull out the victory over the Ragin' Cajuns (2-10). A jump shot by Quentin Gonzales gave McNeese a 64-63 lead with 44 seconds and then the Cowboys scored four straight free throws -- two each by Rorey Lawrence and Bradley. Louisiana-Lafayette went scoreless over the final 3:27 of the game. Joining Bradley in double-figure scoring were John Ford with 17 and Troy Aaron added 12. Louisiana-Lafayette had the game's leading scorer in Ross Mouton who pumped in 22 points. Elijah Millsap led the Cajuns in rebounds with 10. The Cajuns committed 22 turnovers which led to 18 points for the Cowboys.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
